attributes.magic: ASCII text, with very long lines (2263u), with CRLF line terminators

strings: Select * From Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration WHERE IPEnabled = True

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Potentially Suspicious CMD Shell Output Redirect
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects inline Windows shell commands redirecting output via the ">" symbol to a suspicious location.
This technique is sometimes used by malicious actors in order to redirect the output of reconnaissance commands such as "hostname" and "dir" to files for future exfiltration.

match_context.values: @{Hashes=SHA1=13E9BB7E85FF9B08C26A440412E5CD5D296C4D35,MD5=5A6BE4D2519515241D0C133A26CF62C0,SHA256=423E0E810A69AACEBA0E5670E58AFF898CF0EBFFAB99CCB46EBB3464C3D2FACB,IMPHASH=D73E39DAB3C8B57AA408073D01254964; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\system32\; OriginalFileName=Cmd.Exe; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Windows Command Processor; FileVersion=10.0.22621.1635 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\System32\WScript.exe "C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\hh_UTF-8.vbs"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe" /C SystemInfo > C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\rad1CB5F.tmp; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\wscript.exe; IntegrityLevel=Medium; Image=C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects usage of the "systeminfo" command to retrieve information

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\System32\; OriginalFileName=sysinfo.exe; Hashes=SHA1=EA4235858CA18277F4B0BDBF19356CD150FAC1A1,MD5=F13214D51F519FD4206D87760FD6A69B,SHA256=92C41751CE5FE17A23EE8F758583A544C54104E81110C2A69F6AD50DBFF93AE2,IMPHASH=62D18A0582DD061D47BD5429DE1570A2; Description=Displays system information; FileVersion=10.0.22621.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe" /C SystemInfo > C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\rad1CB5F.tmp; CommandLine=SystemInfo  ; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe; IntegrityLevel=Medium; Image=C:\Windows\System32\systeminfo.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

crowdsourced_ai_results.analysis:
The script initializes by creating objects for network interaction, WMI queries, file system operations, shell commands, and data streams. It defines a cryptographic key used for internal obfuscation/encryption routines.

The primary function of the script is to perform reconnaissance and data collection. It gathers the following information:
1.  System/Network Information: MAC address, hostname, domain membership status, domain name, number of computers in the domain (if applicable), current username, and a list of logical drives.
2.  Detailed System Information: Output of the `SystemInfo` command.
3.  Installed Software: Names of installed products using WMI (`Win32_Product`).
4.  Network Configuration: Output of the `IpConfig /All` command.
5.  Running Processes: Names of active processes using WMI (`Win32_Process`).
6.  Desktop Files: Names of all files present on the user's desktop.
7.  Screenshot: Takes a screenshot of the desktop, saves it as a temporary PNG file, reads the binary content, and converts it to Base64 encoding. This process involves writing an obfuscated/encrypted PowerShell script to a temporary file, decrypting and deobfuscating it, executing the PowerShell script to capture the screenshot, and then deleting the temporary script and image files.
8.  Browser History: Extracts URLs from the Google Chrome history file by directly parsing its binary content for "http://" and "https://" strings.

All collected data is concatenated into a single string, with individual data points separated by "%%%". This aggregated string is then written to a newly created temporary file on the system using an ADODB.Stream object with UTF-8 encoding. After writing, a message box displaying "done" is shown. The code implements custom functions for character shifting (`TextShifter`, `TextUnShifter`) and a byte-wise encryption/decryption scheme using the defined cryptographic key. These functions are used to obfuscate embedded PowerShell code for the screenshot functionality.
